intro: Cyrtandra roemeri, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streambanks. It has elliptical to ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra roemeri is notable for its ecological importance and is considered a rare species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
